div.h2: COVID-19: Current Situation in Spokane County

div.p: On March 14, 2020, the Washington State Department of Health (DOH) announced the first cases of COVID-19 in Spokane County. At this time, Spokane Regional Health District (SRHD) encourages community members to follow CDC recommendations for preventing illness, including limiting trips outside of the home and practicing physical distancing, by staying at least six feet away from others. If you have questions about COVID-19, please call the DOH call center at 1.800.525.0127 and press #. See the DOH website for statewide case information.

p.strong: As of April 23, COVID-19 case information for Spokane County will be updated Monday through Friday on srhd.org. New case information reported on Saturdays and Sundays will be included in Monday’s reporting.

p.em: Due to system delays, we are not able to provide data for the number of tests administered or for positive and/or negative test results in Spokane County. Please visit the Washington State Department of Health website for

a.strong: SEE MORE SPOKANE COUNTY CASE INFORMATION
